question: What was the percentage decrease in Jamaica's poverty from 2010 to 2011?
predicted_answer:
The percentage decrease in Jamaica's poverty from 2010 to 2011 was 17.3%.

Explanation:
To find the percentage decrease in poverty, we use the formula:

(P1 - P2 / P1) \* 100%

where P1 is the initial poverty rate and P2 is the poverty rate at the end of the time period.

Using the values provided in the timeline:

P1 = 19.7% (poverty rate in 2010)
P2 = 14.8% (poverty rate in 2011)

Substitute these values into the formula:

(19.7 - 14.8 / 19.7) \* 100%

The percentage decrease in Jamaica's poverty from 2010 to 2011 was 17.3%.
